casebody.data:
Suburban Lodges of America, Inc., Appellant, v. Columbus Graphics Commission, Appellee.

[Cite as Suburban Lodges of Am., Inc. v. Columbus Graphics Comm. (2002), 94 Ohio St.3d 1205.]

(No. 00-2140 Submitted November 13, 2001 Decided January 9, 2002.) Squire, Sanders & Dempsey, L.L.P., David J. Young and Greg R. Wehrer, for appellant.

The cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently allowed.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur. Douglas, J., dissents. Pfeifer and Cook, JJ., dissent. Cook, J.,

dissenting. I respectfully dissent. Instead of dismissing this case as improvidently allowed, I would affirm the judgment of the court’ of appeals.

Pfeifer, J., concurs in the foregoing dissenting opinion. *1206Janet Jackson, City Attorney, Daniel W. Drake, Chief Counsel, and Deborah F. Hoffman, Assistant City Attorney, for appellee. Altick & Corwin Co., L.P.A., Stephen M. McHugh, Matthew D. Stokely and Matthew R. Steinke, urging affirmance for amicus curiae, American Planning Association.
